With utorrent, you can set priority to high on the episodes you want to watch first (normal on the next one, then low on the rest).  That's how I usually get through multiple seasons of shows.

This torrent is set up with individual files so you can do just that.

It may take a long time, but I don't watch them as quickly as they download.

Note:  If you want to watch them in order, use utorrent (or similar torrent app).

In utorrent:
Click the torrent.
Click the files tab.
Highlight all the files (Ctrl+a).
Right-click, set priority to low.
Choose the episode you want to watch, say the pilot.  Right click it and set priority to high.

It will download first, and when it hits 100%, double-click to watch it.

Repeat until you've seen them all.

BTW 1-3% is normal for 'overhead'. "super seeding" is a method to alleviate the load for the Seeder, 1:1, 1 piece is fully seeded 1 time only. Its not a perfect science, since individuals use and settings effect overall performance of the torrent. 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super-seeding
